title: missing messages
content:
I've been archiving my mail locally using Thunderbird (mbox format). Today I transferred some files from one mailbox (Mailbox A) to another (Mailbox B) and by the end some messages cannot be found in either Mailbox A nor B. On a separate issue, I seem to be missing messages that I thought were in Mailbox B previously. Unfortunately when I open the local Mailbox B file in a text editor, I also cannot see the messages I was expecting to find, so I don't think it's an .msf file corruption issue.

Does anyone know where I could potentially recover these messages? I'm a bit distressed to think they are lost forever (my last backup of the local mail storage was unfortunately out of date) but I am guessing this is likely the case. Thank you.

title: Thunderbird Connection Messages
content:
I have 4 email accounts setup. Only one is in use at a time. There is one personal and three tied to 3 volunteer organizations I work with. A few days ago I began getting a Send Message Error window ( I assume generated by Windows) when I attempted to send a message from any of the accounts and thereafter I received a Thunderbird Unable to connect to your IMAP server error message.

My ISP advises they are not restricting connection numbers and this is a Thunderbird issue. Nevertheless, following the Thunderbird Message instructions I reduced the number of cached connections under Advanced by half. This made no difference. There is no one with my ISP who will discuss Thunderbird or seems to know much about it and they want me to use their webmail, which sorely lacks the sophistication of Thunderbird.

Read all of the relevant messages I could locate on the Thunderbird site on the issue and tried most of the suggested solutions, to no avail.

During the solution efforts, all INBOX mail in my primary personal account disappeared, but the rest of the folders are OK and so are those in the other accounts. It is in the ISP IMAP webmail folder.

But when I try to email my ISP I get the Unable to Connect to your IMAP server message or the Thunderbird error message. No outgoing message.

I did look at the Proflies link which I see references the ISP IMAP account. It shows 0 messages and 1.1 GB which I assume is the size of the INBOX file so assume there are messages and the 1.1 GB are the messages, safe but untransferable to Thunderbird. When I clik on Repair Folder the link attemps to go to the ISP IMAP account but the Thunderbird connection error message reappears shutting the process down.

When I just recently upgraded (32 bit) to 115.7 from 115.2 a number, not all, of the folders under my personal account also disappeared (but didn't touch the other accounts). They remain on the ISP webmail site (Zimbra). Could not find a way under Thunderbird how to reimport the missing folders from the ISP webmail account to Thunderbird so have been moving messages I need to save to the folders via the webmail site then reentering Thunderbird.

If this is unclear it's because I am so confused now that I frankly don't know where I am, way way above my pay grade! It appears I've done enough damage so quitting and looking for help.

Image of the two messages attached
creator: w7wll

title: Thunderbird problem with a print
content: Hi there, I am having a problem with the latest version of Mozilla Thunderbird. When I try to print a message from the Sent folder, everything looks fine in the preview, but when I print it to my printer or even to PDF, then I have headers and the first 2 words from the mail, the next is the blank page (should be my message) and on the next page is the message I'm replying to.

title: Thunderbird rules wont filter HTML
content:
Hi all,

I'm wanting to create a rule in Thunderbird to filter HTML tags. Been getting a lot of SPAM using <textarea> tags, which is 100% SPAM as no one ever uses those in an email.

See email source attached.

I've created a rule if "body" contains "<textarea" and "move" to the "Junk" folder, but it fails. Presume it's only looking at text only, not the RAW source which it need to. </p>

I suggest there is an option for "Body (Raw)" which would help get this working. I'm using my @hotmail account and have tried www.outlook.com online and adding a rule in there, but the same happens. It really is stupid that it only looks at the text only, and has NO option to look at the original email body.

Any help would be great, thanks.

title: Thunderbird - 115.7.0: Cant import cancelled recurrence event
content:
Hi!

We found an issue with import cancelled recurrence .ics events which affected by caldav import also.

Steps to reproduce (simple version without caldav server)

  1. Create recurrence event with one participant
  2. Delete/cancel one event from recurrence with notify participant
  3. Download received event of cancellation
  4. Try to import this event to the Thunderbird calendar

Issue caused by:

  • The problematic line is: "RECURRENCE-ID;TZID=Europe/Berlin:20240208T140000"

If i delete this line, the import works as expected.

Can you help with this?

Thanks! BR, Z
creator: s.zoltan.cs

title: Thunderbird ignoring multiple holidays on same day
content:
I recently subscribed to the TB calendar for USA holidays. I reported a problem with the calendar itself and got no response to my last reply ([https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/que.../1438331|here]).

There is also a problem with the way TB displays holidays when more than one appears on the same date for the same region (i.e., where UID:<xx> is the same), possibly also depending on the CATEGORIES or CLASS codes, though I didn't check for that.

For example, for Feb. 11, 2024, TB shows "International Day of Women and Girls in Science" (UID:un), "Super Bowl" (UID:us), and "World Day of the Sick" (UID:world). It does not show "Lunar New Year," which appears in the calendar with UID:us. It appears that when there is more than one holiday on a given date for a given region (US in this case), it displays only one.

This is also the case for May 27, 2024, which is not only "Decoration Day" (UID:us), but is also "Jefferson Davis' Birthday" (UID:us), but TB shows only Decoration Day. (And the calendar has no entry for "Memorial Day," which is the federal holiday on that date. That was the original problem I asked about.)

The entries are listed below for the calendar I downloaded from TB.

=============================================================

Feb. 11 entries:

BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:Lunar New Year DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20240210 DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20240211 DTSTAMP:20240119T095053Z UID:us/lunar-new-year-2024 CATEGORIES:Holidays CLASS:public DESCRIPTION:Observance - Lunar New Year marks the first day of the New Yea 

r in the Chinese calendar.

LAST-MODIFIED:20240119T095053Z TRANSP:transparent END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:International Day of Women and Girls in Science DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20240211 DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20240212 DTSTAMP:20240119T095053Z UID:un/international-day-of-women-and-girls-in-science-2024 CATEGORIES:Holidays CLASS:public DESCRIPTION:United Nations observance - The International Day of Women and 

 Girls in Science is a UN holiday to recognize the critical role women and  girls play in science and technology communities.

LAST-MODIFIED:20240119T095053Z TRANSP:transparent END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:World Day of the Sick DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20240211 DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20240212 DTSTAMP:20240119T095053Z UID:world/world-day-of-the-sick-2024 CATEGORIES:Holidays CLASS:public DESCRIPTION:Worldwide observance - World Day of the Sick is a global event 

 when people remember or pray for the sick.

LAST-MODIFIED:20240119T095053Z TRANSP:transparent END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:Super Bowl DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20240211 DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20240212 DTSTAMP:20240119T095053Z UID:us/super-bowl-2024 CATEGORIES:Holidays CLASS:public DESCRIPTION:Sporting event - The Super Bowl is the championship game of th 

e National Football League (NFL) in the United States. It is played every  year in February.

LAST-MODIFIED:20240119T095053Z TRANSP:transparent END:VEVENT

==========================================================

May 27 Entries

BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:Decoration Day (AK\, AL\, AR\, AZ\, CA) DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20240527 DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20240528 DTSTAMP:20240119T095054Z UID:us/memorial-day-2024 CATEGORIES:Holidays CLASS:public DESCRIPTION:State Holiday - Memorial Day commemorates all Americans who ha 

ve died in military service for the United States.

LAST-MODIFIED:20240119T095054Z TRANSP:transparent END:VEVENT BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:Jefferson Davis' Birthday (Mississippi) DTSTART;VALUE=DATE:20240527 DTEND;VALUE=DATE:20240528 DTSTAMP:20240119T095054Z UID:us/jefferson-davis-birthday-2024 CATEGORIES:Holidays CLASS:public DESCRIPTION:Local observance - Jefferson Davis' Birthday\, also known as J 

efferson Davis Day\, is a state holiday in Alabama in the United States.

LAST-MODIFIED:20240119T095054Z TRANSP:transparent END:VEVENT

title: MULTIPLE EMAIL ACCOUNTS AND ADDRESSES
content:
Beginner or Luddite Question - I am seeking something like outlook, but NOT OUTLOOK. I lost so many contacts, connections, data and usability from that POS. Let's be clear. I am seeking something that will support the following: -having multiple email addresses for multiple businesses and organizations all in one place. - the ability to have individual signature boxes for each email address supported (as many as 12) - Something that won't crash on me and F*** up everything -I don't care if I have to pay, I want everything in one place easy to utilize. - I want a third-party VA to be able to get in under a common sign in and work under my name

Can Thunderbird do all this and more without having to hire a $500 per hour techie? If someone is for hire, how much is the charge?
creator: davidjdunworth

title: Unable to send mail from 1 of 4 similar email accounts
content:
I have 4 email accounts in Thunderbird that I have used for more than a year. Suddenly last week I got the following error when sending from one of the accounts: "Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: Requested action not taken: mailbox unavailable. Sender address is not allowed..Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again." I checked this account's settings to make sure they were identical to those of the other three. Finally, I deleted the account and re-added using the same information. I was able to send email for about 12 hours. Then, the same error returned. What is wrong? What should I do? Note that I can send email from this account using webmail on ionos.com, my website host where all the email addresses reside.

Here is the first part of the Applications Basic info for my system: Application Basics Name Thunderbird Version 115.7.0 Build ID 20240119095007 Distribution ID Update Channel release User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:115.0) Gecko/20100101 Thunderbird/115.7.0 OS Windows_NT 10.0 19045 OS Theme Launcher Process Enabled Multiprocess Windows 0/0 Fission Windows 0/0 Enabled by default Remote Processes 3

Enterprise Policies Inactive Google Location Service Key Missing Google Safebrowsing Key Missing Mozilla Location Service Key Missing Safe Mode false Memory Size (RAM) 6.9 GB Disk Space Available 714 GB
